description: To remove One Sycamore at T2 within TPO 536.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

The applicant wish to remove the Sycamore due to alleged damage to the drainage system and a
possible claim from Thames Water. However no evidence has been provided that Thames Water
have requested the removal of the tree. Furthermore, it is common knowledge that tree roots do not
exploit underground services unless they are in themselves in poor condition, it could therefore be
argued that Thames Water have not adequately maintained their network. The removal of this tree
is seen as a dramatic response and would set an undesirable precedence for the removal of other
large trees, instead Thames Water may wish to look at removing the roots from their network and
an engineering solution such as a sleeve to repair the drain.
